introduction.p: In this section, we explore how certain changes in the formula for a function affect its graph. In particular, we will compare the graph of y = f (x) with the graphs of y = f (x) + k,~~~ \text{ and }~~~ y =f (x + h) for different values of the constants k and h. Such variations are called transformationstransformations of the graph.

subsection.title: Vertical Shifts
subsection.p: shows the graphs of f (x) = x^2 + 4, g(x) = x^2 - 4, and the basic parabola, y = x^2. By comparing tables of values, we can see exactly how the graphs of f and g are related to the basic parabola.

Each y-value in the table for f (x) is four units greater than the corresponding y-value for the basic parabola y=x^2 . Consequently, each point on the graph of f (x) is four units higher than the corresponding point on the basic parabola, as shown by the arrows. Similarly, each point on the graph of g(x) is four units lower than the corresponding point on the basic parabola.

The graphs of y = f (x) and y = g(x) are said to be translationstranslations (or shifts) of the graph of y = x^2. They are shifted to a different location in the plane but retain the same size and shape as the original graph. In general, we have the following principles.

assemblage.title: Vertical Shifts
assemblage.p:
Let k\gt 0. Compared with the graph of y = f (x),
the graph of y=f(x)+k is shifted upward k units, and
the graph of y=f(x)-k is shifted downward k units.

statement.p:
Graph the following functions.
g(x) = \abs{x} + 3 and y=\abs{x} and discuss how they are related.
h(x) = \dfrac{1}{x}- 2 and y=\frac{1}{x} and discuss how they are related.

li.p: The table shows that the y-values for g(x) are each three units greater than the corresponding y-values for the absolute value function. The graph of g(x) = \abs{x} + 3 is a translation of the basic graph of y = \abs{x}, shifted upward three units, as shown in .

The table shows that the y-values for h(x) are each two units smaller than the corresponding y-values for y = \dfrac{1}{x}. The graph of h(x) = \dfrac{1}{x} - 2 is a translation of the basic graph of y = \dfrac{1}{x}, shifted downward two units, as shown in .

solution.p: The graph of y = f (h) + 300 is a vertical translation of the graph of f,

sidebyside.p: as shown in . At each hour of the day, or for each value of h, the y-coordinate is 300 greater than on the graph of f. So at each hour, the community is drawing 300 megawatts more power than in 2002.

statement.p: An evaporative cooler, or swamp cooler, is an energy-efficient type of air conditioner used in dry climates. A typical swamp cooler can reduce the temperature inside a house by 15 degrees. a shows the graph of T = f (t), the temperature inside Kate's house t hours after she turns on the swamp cooler. Write a formula in terms of f for the function g shown in b and, give a possible explanation of its meaning.

solution.p: The graph of g is a vertical translation of f, 10 units up. Therefore g(t) = f (t) + 10. Its meaning could be that it measures the same thing as f but that the outside temperature was 10\degree hotter.

subsection.title: Horizontal Shift
subsection.p: Now consider the graphs of f (x) = (x + 2)^2 and g(x) = (x - 2)^2 shown in . Compared with the graph of the basic function y = x^2, the graph of f (x) = (x + 2)^2 is shifted two units to the left, as shown by the arrows. You can see why this happens by studying the function values in the table.

Locate a particular y-value for y = x^2, say, y = 4. You must move two units to the left in the table to find the same y-value for f (x), as shown by the arrow. In fact, each y-value for f (x) occurs two units to the left when compared to the same y-value for y = x^2.

Similarly, the graph of g(x) = (x - 2)^2 is shifted two units to the right compared to the graph of y = x^2. In the table for g, each y-value for g(x) occurs two units to the right of the same y-value for y = x^2. In general, we have the following principle.

assemblage.title: Horizontal Shifts
assemblage.p:
Let h\gt 0. Compared with the graph of y = f (x),
the graph of y = f (x + h)~ ~ is shifted h units to the left, and
the graph of y = f (x - h)~ ~ is shifted h units to the right.

note.p: At first, the direction of a horizontal translation may seem counterintuitive. Look again at the tables above to help you see how the shift occurs.

The function N = f (p) graphed in gives the number of people who have a given eye pressure level p measured in millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) from a sample of 100 people with healthy eyes, and the function g gives the number of people with pressure level p in a sample of 100 glaucoma patients.

ol.label: a
ol.li: Write a formula for g as a transformation of f.
For what pressure readings could a doctor be fairly certain that a patient has glaucoma?

ol.label: a
ol.li: The graph of g is translated 10 units to the right of f, so g(p) = f (p - 10).
Pressure readings above 40mm Hg are a strong indication of glaucoma. Readings between 10 and 40mm Hg cannot conclusively distinguish healthy eyes from those with glaucoma.

statement.p: The function C = f (t) in gives the caffeine level in Delbert's bloodstream at time t hours after he drinks a cup of coffee, and g(t) gives the caffeine level in Francine's bloodstream. Write a formula for g in terms of f, and explain what it tells you about Delbert and Francine.

solution.p: The graph of g is a horizontal translation of f; it appears to have been shifted about 3 units to the right. Thus g(t) = f (t - 3). This could be because Francine drank her coffee 3 hours after Delbert drank his.
